column2: U.S. attempt to unlock San Bernardino iPhone could impact N.Y. case: Apple NEW YORK
column3: March 25 Apple Inc said the U.S. Justice Department's new attempts to unlock an iPhone used by one of the San Bernardino shooters without the tech giant's help could eliminate the government's need for its assistance in a similar dispute in New York.

column2: UPDATE 1-Lockheed gets $1.5 bln deal for C-130J aircraft -Pentagon WASHINGTON
column3: March 24 Lockheed Martin Corp  has won a contract worth $1.5 billion for work on 28 C-130J military transport aircraft funded by the fiscal 2016 defense budget
column4: the Pentagon said on Thursday in its daily digest of major contracts.

column2: REFILE-UPDATE 4-Premier Foods investors urge McCormick talks after Nissin deal LONDON
column3: March 24 Two major shareholders in Premier Foods urged it on Thursday to hold talks with U.S. suitor McCormick
column4: after the British company formed an alliance with Japanese instant noodle maker Nissin Foods .
